#Text=Feared toll of Indonesian floods , landslides up to 130 ; dozens missing as bridge swept away
#Text=Thursday , December 27 , 2007
#Text=Heavy rains in Indonesia yesterday triggered widespread flooding and landslides across the nation .
#Text=It has emerged that last night a bridge was swept away by the swollen river it stretched across , leaving around 40 to 50 people missing in Madiun , East Java .
#Text=Meanwhile , the total toll of those known or feared to be dead has reached 130 .
#Text=According to local police chief Supardi in a telephone conversation with Xinhua the flood waters weakened a foundation , resulting in the collapse .
#Text=At least twenty motorcyclists , car drivers and passengers are thought to be dead , but as of midnight , no bodies had been recovered .
#Text=However , three bikes have been retrieved . 100 rescuers have been dispatched to the scene .
#Text=Continuing heavy rain forced the search to be abandoned temporarily .
#Text=Java as a whole is the worst affected island ; in addition to the bridge collapse most of the landslides occurred in two Central Java districts .
#Text=Health ministry official Rustam Pakaya told reporters that at least 28,000 people have been forced to abandon their homes in central Java , although exact figures are not yet available .
#Text=The Red Cross commented that 45,000 East Javanese people have been similarly displaced .
#Text=Thousands are seeking shelter in mosques and other public buildings .

#Text=Landslides buried houses and made roads impassable , while hundreds police officers , military personnel , local officials and volunteers have been digging with farm tools and even their hands to search for survivors .
#Text=Heavy machinery is available but the road conditions have prevented it arriving at the areas where it is required .
#Text=Jakarta has dispatched aid in the form of five tonnes of biscuits and instant meals , ten tonnes of baby food and multiple boats .
#Text=Heru Aji Pratomo , head of the disaster management centre in the worst-hit district of Karanganyar has confirmed the recovery of twelve more bodies .
#Text=This brings the total confirmed death toll in the area to 48 .
#Text=He said that most bodies were recovered from three metre deep mud and required heavy digging machinery to retrieve .
#Text=28 remain missing .
#Text=Local resident Siswo told AFP " Suddenly I felt my house shaking , and I thought it was an earthquake .

#Text=Islamic cleric Abu Bakar Bashir toured a Karanganyar village , at which time he commented that he felt the disaster had been caused as a form of divine revenge , saying  This was likely caused by immoral acts going on here , " and " This could be a lesson to be learned .
